alert.note: Alert for Montgomery (Maryland) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Baltimore/Washington (Washington D.C., Central Maryland, Northern Virginia, Eastern West Virginia)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued August 05 at 6:58PM EDT by NWS Baltimore/Washington
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1145 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...Portions of central Maryland and northern Virginia, including the following counties: in central Maryland, Montgomery. In northern Virginia, Fairfax. * WHEN...Until 1145 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 655 PM EDT, the public reported flooding occurring in parts of northeast Fairfax County. Between 1.5 and 2.5 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of up to 0.5 inches are possible in the warned area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Arlington... Bethesda... Vienna... Pimmit Hills... Mclean... American Legion Bridge... Potomac... Tysons Corner... Wolf Trap... Dunn Loring... Cabin John... Somerset... Glen Echo... West Mclean... Langley... Belleview... - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
